doc.name: Concept
doc.description:
A concept represents a single piece of information in an ontology. An instance of this class is always associated with a particular ontology, which is specified in the constructor.

Note that this is an abstract class. Any concrete instance must be either a FiniteConcept or an InfiniteConcept.
doc.author: Ben Lickly, Edward A. Lee, Dai Bui, Christopher Brooks
doc.property: A parameter indicating whether this concept is an acceptable outcome during inference. This is a boolean that defaults to true.
